fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: MetLife LTC LifeStage AdvantageSM

fields.name: Subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: Header Right
fields.value: INSURANCE | LONG-TERM CARE

fields.name: Brand
fields.value: MetLife

fields.name: Plan Name - Simple Advantage
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGE4 PLAN

fields.name: Plan Name - Custom Advantage
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGE4 PLAN

fields.name: Plan Type (description)
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available 	6 see below)

fields.name: Issue Ages - Simple Advantage
fields.value: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Issue Ages - Custom Advantage
fields.value: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: MBA and TBA Label
fields.value: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)

fields.name: MBA/TBA Options - Simple Advantage
fields.value: MBA options shown: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K. TBA (Total Benefit Amount) options shown: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K (No $1MM for Simple with Cash Benefit Rider note).

fields.name: MBA/TBA Options - Custom Advantage
fields.value: MBA options shown: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K. TBA options shown: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K and $1MM ("$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider" noted).

fields.name: Optional Riders Heading
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider - name
fields.value: Shared Care Rider

fields.name: Shared Care Rider - description
fields.value: Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted. When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies.

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider - name
fields.value: Nonforfeiture Rider

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider - description
fields.value: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or is cancelled by insured. Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends. Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA. Available at initial application only.

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider - name
fields.value: Cash Benefit Rider

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider - description
fields.value: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services. Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available. Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option heading
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option details
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting. Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates. Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA. Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised. Rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday, or when insured no longer eligible.

tables.caption: Plan comparison: SIMPLE ADVANTAGE PLAN vs CUSTOM ADVANTAGE PLAN

rows.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available)
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available)

Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies, remaining TBA transfers to spouse/partner at no extra cost; available at any time subject to underwriting.

Provides benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or is cancelled; must be in effect for 3 years; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to greater of premiums paid or 1x MBA; available at initial application only.
Full MBA paid as cash payment instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; tax implications may apply.

fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: section_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care (feature)
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services - Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services - Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver - Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care (feature)
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage is provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums, or the insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined based on NAIC guidelines); Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB) and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider

fields.name: additional_information_header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal* – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Save Age
fields.value: Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)

fields.name: Policy Effective Dates
fields.value: With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

fields.name: Free Look Period
fields.value: Insured has 30 days to review policy and if desired, return it for a full refund

fields.name: Policy Delivery
fields.value: Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date

fields.name: company_name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

fields.name: company_address
fields.value: New York, NY 10166

notes: The provided document is an insurance product brochure (MetLife LTC LifeStage Advantage). It does not contain facility invoice, CMR form, or UB-04 claim data (invoice numbers, policy/claim service dates, line items, provider billing tax IDs, signatures, etc.).

All three target sections (facilityInvoice, cmrForm, ub04) are intentionally left empty because no applicable evidence was found in the OCR fields/tables. Fields such as company_name and company_address are present but part of brochure/legal footer and not invoice/provider billing information; therefore sections were not populated.

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

values.value: Shared Care Rider

fields.bestValue: Shared Care Rider

values.value: Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted. When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies.

fields.bestValue: Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted. When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies.

values.value: Nonforfeiture Rider

fields.bestValue: Nonforfeiture Rider

values.value: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or is cancelled by insured. Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends. Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA. Available at initial application only.

fields.bestValue: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or is cancelled by insured. Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends. Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA. Available at initial application only.

values.value: Cash Benefit Rider

fields.bestValue: Cash Benefit Rider

values.value: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services. Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available. Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

fields.bestValue: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services. Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available. Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

values.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.bestValue: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

values.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting. Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates. Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA. Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised. Rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday, or when insured no longer eligible.

fields.bestValue: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting. Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates. Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA. Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised. Rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday, or when insured no longer eligible.

fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage is provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums, or the insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined based on NAIC guidelines); Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
